content.description: Begin underclinging on the northwest arete and traverse left. The crux comes after the namesake crescent (luckily you don't have to use the weeping part). A low to the ground hold, a heelhook and some left hand crimping will see you through to the end. Technical.
content.location: Located on the north face of the giant pebble boulder. Shady most of the day.

content.description: This line climbs the obvous slight lichenous dihedral in the middle of the SW face.  May be reachy and harder at the start for those under 5'8".  Crank past the first thin crimp in the dihedral to some sloping holds and you'll have this one in the bag. Just be careful pulling over the top.
content.protection: Spotter and pad nice, but has a sloping landing. Careful of loose and licheny topout.

content.description: Really a face with several options, but all about the same grade.  Climb up the slabby S face of the rock. Can add a few moves by traversing in from lower on the SW face. Not an exceedingly attractive line.
content.protection: Pad and spotters nice but not necessary unless you are uncomfortable at the grade. Be careful, a little licheny and possible friable rock.
